Metadata: Plasmids mediating iron uptake in "Vibrio anguillarum" strains isolated from turbot in Spain

The presence of plasmids in turbot "Vibrio" isolates was associated with the bacteria's ability to cause disease in fish. Plasmid-​carrying vibrios could grow under conditions of iron limitation; nonvirulent plasmidless derivatives could not, and were also unable to produce either siderophore activity or the iron-regulated 86 kDal outer membrane protein, suggesting the plasmid-​mediated nature of these components.
